g.text: Entropy Change Characteristics of the LiNi
Peng Zhang, Xin Liu, Yanxia Liu, Guosheng Shao, and Kehua Dai
Lithium-ion batteries are widely used in the ﬁeld of new energy vehicles and energy storage. Understanding the
electrode reaction of lithium-ion batteries is the key to improve their cycle life and safety. Direct measurement of thermodynamic
data of the electrode reaction is a practical, economical, and nondestructive method for electrode characterization. In this paper, the
/Li half-cell is measured at diﬀerent discharge states and diﬀerent temperatures. The d
SOD (state of discharge) relation curves are ﬁtted linearly by the least square method, and the entropy change values of
diﬀerent SODs are calculated. Finally, the Gibbs free energy and enthalpy change of diﬀerent SODs are obtained. The electrode
in diﬀerent SODs was discussed by the entropy change in diﬀerent SODs. According to the evolution
, the lithium intercalation reaction of LiNi
may be a single-phase solid solution reaction rather than a two-
phase reaction. Finally, the reversible heat generation at diﬀerent current values and SODs are calculated.
Lithium-ion batteries are widely used in the ﬁeld of new energy
The cycle life and safety of
lithium-ion batteries are the most concerned issues.
order to improve the cycle life, it is necessary to understand the
mechanism of the electrode reaction and decay.
concerns, one of the important issues is improving the battery
The design improvement requires better under-
standing of the heat generation behavior of batteries in
charging and discharging, which is determined by the
characteristics of the electrode material itself.
Currently, many in situ characterization methods are used to
understand the electrode reaction and decay mechanism of
methods often need to be combined with specially designed
cell models and electrode materials with special morphology,
which is not convenient in many cases. Therefore, direct
measurement of the thermodynamic data of the electrode
reaction is a practical and economic means of electrode
characterization, which is often ignored by material research-
The measurement of electrode reaction and thermody-
namic parameters is carried out in the half-cell or the full-cell.
The whole measurement process has a little disturbance to the
battery, so it can be considered to be a nondestructive in situ
battery detection method. In other words, commercial lithium-
ion batteries can be detected in situ without damage. In
addition, thermodynamic characterization can be used not only
to characterize the thermal properties of various electrode
materials but also to characterize the structural changes and
electrode reactions in the process of charging and discharg-
It is a powerful method to study the cycle life and safety
The three most important thermodynamic parameters of the
electrode reaction are Gibbs free energy
. The change in Gibbs free energy
maximum work of the battery. The change in lattice order is
